actions.committee: House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce.

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, with respect to expenditures made for the use of communications media in order to oppose the candidacy of a legally qualified candidate for Federal elective office.

summary.text: Provides, under the Federal Election Campaign Act, that amounts spent for the use of communications media in order to oppose any legally qualified candidate for Federal elective office (or for nomination to such office) shall be deemed to have been spent by the candidate who authorized the use.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, with respect to expenditures made for the use of communications media in order to oppose the candidacy of a legally qualified candidate for Federal elective office.
